roleset.name: finished, over
roleset.note: THROUGH-J NOTES: Added by Julia. Comparison to finish.01, do.02.

role.descr: entity that is done being affected/effected

example.name: through-j
example.text: Now that the war is through with me. I'm waking up, I cannot see.

example.name: through-j
example.text: When the Government is through with his education he will be a top- notch printer, the kind that every composing-room foreman will welcome.

example.name: through-j
example.text: Once the war is through, I will go back home.

roleset.name: spatial (may be metaphorical/abstract): on the other side of a barrier/passage

example.name: through-j
example.text: Whole front half of the vehicle is through the wall of the Gardens.
example.arg: Whole front half of the vehicle

example.name: through-j: sports
example.text: Rafael Nadal is through to the semi-finals of the China Open after coming from a set down to beat Jack Sock.
example.arg: to the semi-finals of the China Open
after coming from a set down to beat Jack Sock

roleset.name: experiential: passage through an experience
roleset.note: THROUGH-J NOTES: Added by Julia. This is currently half-formed-- the finished frame will include an MWE alias 'go_through', which I mention because it may be helpful in understanding the full intention of this sense and why it is split off from through.02. Because 'go_through' was already covered by go.12, that roleset will be rolled into this one.

example.name: through-j
example.text: That girl has been through hell and back with me
example.note: This is an experience that is described using the spatial framework of through.02. If the intention was really to describe a Dantean trip through hell as an actual location, it would be appropriate to use through.02. But since this is referring to a hellish experience, we can use through.03.

example.name: through-j
example.text: The fact that these words are spoken by compatriots who-1 *-1 have been through the disaster has given us, who couldn't help our tears at the sight of their mishaps, so much comfort and encouragement.
